Package actions

Class ActionMethods

java.lang.Object
actions.ActionMethods
public class ActionMethods extends Object
This class consists of all action methods which will be used to automate from excel
Author:
Dhanush

    • startTest

      public com.aventstack.extentreports.ExtentTest startTest​(String testcaseName)
      Creates a test in the report with the given name and returns an ExtentTest instance representing the test case.
      Parameters:
      testcaseName - The name of the test case.
      Returns:
      The ExtentTest instance representing the test case.

    • closeReportLogger

      public void closeReportLogger()
      Finalizes the report logger and logs a success message if the operation succeeds, or logs a failure message if the operation throws an exception.

    • deleteFile

      public void deleteFile​(String fileName, String filePath)
      Deletes a file with the specified file name and file path.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the file to be deleted.
      filePath - The path where the file is located, relative to the repository path. This should not include the repository path itself.

    • deleteFile

      public void deleteFile​(String docPath)
      Deletes a document (file) from the given path.
      Parameters:
      docPath - The path of the document to be deleted.

    • assertXMLExist

      public void assertXMLExist​(String documentPath, String expected)
      Checks whether the given string exists in an XML file located in the repository or program data. Logs the result of the assertion in the report.
      Parameters:
      documentPath - The path of the XML file in the repository or program data.
      expected - The string to be searched for in the XML file.

    • assertXMLNotExist

      public void assertXMLNotExist​(String documentPath, String expected)
      Checks whether the given string does not exist in an XML file located in the repository or program data. Logs the result of the assertion in the report.
      Parameters:
      documentPath - The path of the XML file in the repository or program data.
      expected - The string not to be found in the XML file.

    • assertFileExists

      public void assertFileExists​(String fileName, String filePath)
      Checks whether a file exists in the given path from the repository. Logs the result of the assertion in the report.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the file to check for existence.
      filePath - The path where the file is located, relative to the repository path.

    • assertName

      public void assertName​(String controlType, String IDValue, String expected)
      Verifies the 'name' attribute of a UI element identified by the 'controlType' and 'IDValue' parameters. Logs the result of the assertion in the report.
      Parameters:
      controlType - The type of the UI element (e.g., "id", "name", "text", etc.).
      IDValue - The value used to identify the UI element (e.g., the ID, name, or text).
      expected - The expected 'name' attribute value of the UI element.

    • assertExist

      public void assertExist​(String locatorType, String parameter1, String parameter2)
      Verifies whether an element exists and logs the result in the report.
      Parameters:
      locatorType - The type of locator used to find the element (e.g., "id", "name", "text", etc.).
      parameter1 - The first parameter used in the element identification (e.g., the ID, name, or text).
      parameter2 - The second parameter used in the element identification (if required).

    • assertNotExist

      public void assertNotExist​(String locatorType, String parameter1, String parameter2)
      Verifies whether an element does not exist and logs the result in the report.
      Parameters:
      locatorType - The type of locator used to find the element (e.g., "id", "name", "text", etc.).
      parameter1 - The first parameter used in the element identification (e.g., the ID, name, or text).
      parameter2 - The second parameter used in the element identification (if required).

    • compareGPS

      public void compareGPS​(String baseFileName, String currentFileName)
      Compares the given GPS file from the repository with the base file present in the base files folder. Logs the comparison result in the report.
      Parameters:
      baseFileName - The name of the base GPS file in the base files folder.
      currentFileName - The name of the current GPS file in the repository.

    • setRootSearch

      public void setRootSearch​(String value)
      Sets the root search behavior. If 'true', it searches the full system; if 'false', it searches in the given window.
      Parameters:
      value - 'true' to search the full system, 'false' to search in the given window.

    • waitToDisplay

      public void waitToDisplay​(String locatorType, String parameter1, String parameter2)
      Waits for the given element to be displayed on the screen for up to the maximum wait duration.
      Parameters:
      locatorType - The type of locator to identify the element (e.g., "id", "name", "text").
      parameter1 - The first parameter for locating the element (e.g., control type or image path).
      parameter2 - The second parameter for locating the element (e.g., control value or image path).
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the element fails to be displayed within the maximum wait duration.

    • waitToDisplay

      public void waitToDisplay​(String locatorType, String parameter1, String parameter2, String duration)
      Waits for the given element to be displayed on the screen for up to the specified duration.
      Parameters:
      locatorType - The type of locator to identify the element (e.g., "id", "name", "text").
      parameter1 - The first parameter for locating the element (e.g., control type or image path).
      parameter2 - The second parameter for locating the element (e.g., control value or image path).
      duration - The duration to wait in seconds.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the element fails to be displayed within the specified duration.

    • waitToVanish

      public void waitToVanish​(String locatorType, String parameter1, String parameter2)
      Waits for the given element to vanish from the screen for up to the maximum wait duration.
      Parameters:
      locatorType - The type of locator to identify the element (e.g., "id", "name", "text").
      parameter1 - The first parameter for locating the element (e.g., control type or image path).
      parameter2 - The second parameter for locating the element (e.g., control value or image path).
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the element fails to vanish within the maximum wait duration.

    • waitToVanish

      public void waitToVanish​(String locatorType, String parameter1, String parameter2, String duration)
      Waits for the given element to vanish from the screen for up to the specified duration.
      Parameters:
      locatorType - The type of locator to identify the element (e.g., "id", "name", "text").
      parameter1 - The first parameter for locating the element (e.g., control type or image path).
      parameter2 - The second parameter for locating the element (e.g., control value or image path).
      duration - The duration to wait in seconds.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the element fails to vanish within the specified duration.

    • waitToEnable

      public void waitToEnable​(String locatorType, String controlType, String value, String duration)
      Waits for the specified element to become enabled within the given duration time.
      Parameters:
      locatorType - The type of locator used to identify the element (e.g., "id", "name", "text").
      controlType - The type of control used to identify the element (e.g., "button", "textbox").
      value - The value of the locator used to find the element (e.g., the ID, name, or XPath expression).
      duration - The maximum time (in seconds) to wait for the element to become enabled.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the element fails to become enabled within the specified duration.

    • waitToEnable

      public void waitToEnable​(String locatorType, String controlType, String value)
      Waits for the specified element to become enabled within the default maximum duration time.
      Parameters:
      locatorType - The type of locator used to identify the element (e.g., "id", "name", "text").
      controlType - The type of control used to identify the element (e.g., "button", "textbox").
      value - The value of the locator used to find the element (e.g., the ID, name, or XPath expression).
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the element fails to become enabled within the default maximum duration time.

    • click

      public void click​(String locatorType, String parameter1, String parameter2)
      Clicks on the specified element.
      Parameters:
      locatorType - The type of locator used to identify the element (e.g., "id", "name", "xpath").
      parameter1 - The first parameter based on the locator type, which can be the control type, search area image, or X-coordinate value.
      parameter2 - The second parameter based on the locator type, which can be the control value, search element image, or Y-coordinate value. element.

      Starts the Remote Capture (RC) by launching the specified application.
      Parameters:
      applicationPath - The path to the application executable or file to be captured by Remote Capture. The applicationPath should point to the executable or file associated with the application that you want to capture remotely. Note: The behavior of this method depends on the implementation of the 'remoteClient' and its compatibility with the application type specified by 'applicationPath'.
      Throws:
      SomeException - (e.g., RemoteCaptureException) if there is an error while starting the Remote Capture.

    • stopRC

      public void stopRC()
      Stops the Remote Capture (RC) that was previously started.
      Throws:
      SomeException - (e.g., RemoteCaptureException) if there is an error while stopping the Remote Capture. This may happen if the Remote Capture was not successfully started or if there are connectivity issues with the remote capturing system.

    • updateSetting

      public void updateSetting​(String status)
      Updates Epiplex settings for automation with the specified status.
      Parameters:
      status - The status to be set for automation. Should be represented as a boolean value (e.g., "true" or "false").
      Throws:
      SomeException - (e.g., XMLParsingException) if there is an error while updating the Epiplex capture settings. The exception may occur due to issues with XML parsing or updating the settings file.

    • updateCaptureSetting

      public void updateCaptureSetting​(String setting)
      Updates Epiplex capture settings for automation with the specified setting.
      Parameters:
      setting - The setting to be updated. The valid options are "SCREEN VIDEO", "CAPTURE AUDIO", or "AUDIO VIDEO". Use one of these values to enable or disable the corresponding capture feature in Epiplex.
      Throws:
      SomeException - (e.g., XMLParsingException) if there is an error while updating the Epiplex capture settings. The exception may occur due to issues with XML parsing or updating the settings file.

    • assertNodeExist

      public void assertNodeExist​(String documentPath, String tagName, String attribute, String value)
      Asserts that a node with the specified tag name and attribute value exists in the XML file located at the given document path.
      Parameters:
      documentPath - The path to the XML document file (e.g., REPOPATH or PROGRAMDATA) in which to search for the node.
      tagName - The name of the XML tag representing the node to be searched for.
      attribute - The attribute type to be used for the search. It can be either "TEXT" or an attribute name.
      value - The attribute value to be matched in the node.
      Throws:
      SomeException - (e.g., XMLParsingException) if there is an error while parsing the XML file or if the node is not found. The exception may occur due to issues with XML parsing or when the node with the specified tag and attribute value is not found in the XML file.

    • assertNodeNotExist

      public void assertNodeNotExist​(String documentPath, String tagName, String attribute, String value)
      Asserts that a node with the specified tag name and attribute value does not exist in the XML file located at the given document path.
      Parameters:
      documentPath - The path to the XML document file (e.g., REPOPATH or PROGRAMDATA) in which to search for the node.
      tagName - The name of the XML tag representing the node to be searched for.
      attribute - The attribute type to be used for the search. It can be either "TEXT" or an attribute name.
      value - The attribute value to be matched in the node.
      Throws:
      SomeException - (e.g., XMLParsingException) if there is an error while parsing the XML file or if the node is found. The exception may occur due to issues with XML parsing or when the node with the specified tag and attribute value is found in the XML file.

    • selectWindow

      public void selectWindow​(String mode)
      Updates the Window mode settings for automation to the specified mode.
      Parameters:
      mode - The mode to be set for automation. Valid options are: "DESKTOP", "ACTIVE WINDOW", "FULL SCREEN", "DOCUMENT AREA", or "CUSTOM SIZE".
      Throws:
      SomeException - (e.g., XMLParsingException) if there is an error while updating the Window mode settings. The exception may occur due to issues with XML parsing or updating the settings file.

    • startCapture

      public void startCapture​(String captureFileName)
      Starts the capture process with the specified capture file name.
      Parameters:
      captureFileName - The name of the capture file to be created for the recording.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there is an error while starting the capture process. This exception is thrown as a runtime exception to propagate any errors that occur during the capture process.

    • startCaptureManual

      public void startCaptureManual​(String captureFileName)
      Starts the manual capture process with the specified capture file name.
      Parameters:
      captureFileName - The name of the capture file to be created for the manual recording.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there is an error while starting the manual capture process. This exception is thrown as a runtime exception to propagate any errors that occur during the manual capture process.

    • startCapturePerformance

      public void startCapturePerformance​(String captureFileName)
      Starts the performance capture process with the default capture settings.
      Parameters:
      captureFileName - The name of the capture file to be created for the performance recording.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there is an error while starting the performance capture process. This exception is thrown as a runtime exception to propagate any errors that occur during the performance capture process.

    • saveCapture

    • cancelCapture

      public void cancelCapture()
      Cancels the ongoing capture process.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there is an error while canceling the capture process. This exception is thrown as a runtime exception to propagate any errors that occur while canceling the capture process.

    • cancelCapturePerformance

      public void cancelCapturePerformance()

      Throws:

    • performanceTestDoc

      public void performanceTestDoc​(String captureFileName)
      Performs a performance test on document generation using the specified capture file.
      Parameters:
      captureFileName - The name of the capture file to be used for the performance test.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there is an error while performing the performance test on document generation. This exception is thrown as a runtime exception to propagate any errors that occur during the performance test.

    • displayFileType

      public void displayFileType​(String fileType)
      Selects the display file type in the home page.
      Parameters:
      fileType - The file type to be selected for display. (e.g., "PDF", "DOCX", "PPTX", "XLS", "XLSX", etc.)
      Throws:
      EventFailException - if there is an error while selecting the display file type. This exception is thrown to handle any specific event failure that may occur during the display file type selection.

    • generateDocument

      public void generateDocument​(String fileType, String fileName, String filePath)
      Generates a document of the specified file type with the given name and saves it to the specified file path.
      Parameters:
      fileType - The type of document to be generated. (e.g., "PDF", "DOCX", "PPTX", "XLS", "XLSX", etc.)
      fileName - The name of the generated document file.
      filePath - The path where the generated document file should be saved.
